db:abstract.db:para: Platform specific notes for Qt Quick Controls.

db:article.db:para: This page contains platform specific notes for creating applications that use Qt Quick Controls.

db:section.db:title: Android Style
db:section.db:para: Qt 5.4 introduced a native Android style for Qt Quick Controls.

db:note.db:para: The Android style requires Android 3.0 (API level 11) or later.

db:section.db:para: The style is automatically selected and deployed on Android. See Getting Started with Qt for Android and Deploying an Application on Android for more details on the Android essentials.

db:section.db:title: Android Themes

db:section.db:title: Action Bar
db:section.db:para: The Action Bar is a special Android control that provides many key features including various navigation modes, actions, an options menu, a back button, and also displays the application icon and title.

Unlike Qt Widgets, Qt Quick Controls do not use the native action bar on Android. ToolBar and MenuBar are offered as a cross-platform replacement. They are unified to a single "action bar" when assigned to the appropriate ApplicationWindow properties.
The advantage of a non-native ToolBar is that it can contain any child items declared in QML. Just to name a few possibilities:
